titleInfo.title: Copy of photograph of Samretta Griffin Boulware Fritz from her funeral program, 1993

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: This image from the funeral program of Samretta Griffin Fritz appears to be a studio photograph taken in the 1950s. Samretta Griffin Fritz (1921-1993) was an active clubwoman and member of her church, the Little Leaf Baptist Church. She served as President of the Mission Society and the Baptist Training Union and founded and directed a Girl's Club for Little Leaf Baptist Church. In addition to her leadership roles in the church, Samretta Griffin Fritz was heavily involved in her local municipal community. She was a member of the Executive Committee of the Anderson County Democrats, a member of the Oliver Springs Planning Commission, and worked as a poll worker for many years. She was employed by Anderson County Food Services until her retirement in 1984. She was born November 18, 1921 in Oliver Springs, Tennessee and died January 1, 1993 and is buried in Carter's Bluff Cemetery in Oliver Springs, Tennessee.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
